# PR Summary

The purpose of this PR is to improve the getcomputer-info command. Today the command retrieves all of the data from WMI and then filters the results based on the property names specified by the user.
This means that the following commands take the same amount of time to execute.

````powershell
Get-ComputerInfo
Get-ComputerInfo -Property BiosCharacteristics
````
In order to correct this I am storing the relationship between a WMI-queryable property and the WMI class to which it belongs in order to go from

```SQL
SELECT * FROM Win32_Bios
````
to 
````SQL
SELECT BiosCharacteristics FROM Win32_Bios
````

This PR is currently WIP since I have to add support for all of the properties a user can ask for but it sets the basic structure in place. I am hoping to get feedback on this general flow 😄 

@powercode also suggested removing the filtering capability and having the user simply combine Get-ComputerInfo with Select-Object to obtain feature parity but this can be had in a separate discussion (just thought it might be interesting to restate).

## PR Context

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/9234
